page.title: 14Farming: Wray
page.content: On May 13th, 1985, we went to Higher Broadwood Farm. We asked the farmer's wife about the qualities necessary for her work and she said that they were strength, not minding dirt or mud, and being a good cook. She has two Jacob's sheep, one of which has two lambs. She uses their brown, black and white fleece to make wool which she weaves into sweaters. When the farmer came home for lunch, we asked him some similar questions. He said that you need to love animals and be prepared to stay up with them when they are ill or pregnant. The farm consists of two houses, a milking parlour, a barn, some cubicles for cows, a sheep dip, a slurry pit, a dairy, a maternity building and a hen hut. In front of the garden is a field for growing the family's vegetables.
